The PROTECT Students Act is critical to providing basic consumer protections to our students and veterans and preparing them for the future. You can read more about our bill here: https://www.hassan.senate.gov/news/press-releases/senators-hassan-and-durbin-introduce-comprehensive-legislation-to-protect-students-and-taxpayers-from-predatory-higher-education-practices …

The recent collapse of for-profit colleges continues to show that these institutions represent a disproportionate risk to students and taxpayers, but instead of addressing this, Education Secretary Betsy DeVos has worked to roll back reforms. https://medium.com/@SenatorHassan/standing-against-students-heres-how-betsy-devos-is-supporting-shady-for-profit-colleges-40f7cded58a0 …

Our bill would:
   
 - Close a loophole that encourages for-profit colleges to target veterans 
 - Ensure that institutions are preparing students for good-paying jobs
 - Strengthen protections for student loan borrowers who have been defrauded or cheated

Too often, shady for-profit colleges prey on students and veterans and do not give them the quality education they deserve. Today, @SenatorDurbin and I are introducing the #PROTECTstudents Act to help stop these practices.

The full Mueller report and its underlying evidence need to be made public; a summary written by the Attorney General appointed by the President to oversee this investigation will not suffice.

I'm delighted that our bipartisan conservation bill was signed into law and that it includes important measures for NH, like permanently reauthorizing the Land and Water Conservation Fund, protecting the Nashua River, and redesignating Saint-Gaudens as a National Historic Park.

Members of both parties have made clear that President Trump’s budget proposal isn’t going anywhere, and I’ll keep working across the aisle on a fiscally responsible budget that supports priorities like the health of our people, our economy, and bolsters our national security.
I am also troubled that this proposal harms economic development, hinders our efforts to support innovative businesses, and undermines environmental protections.

President Trump is proposing to:

- slash $845 billion from Medicare (which he said he would not do)
- cut and cap Medicaid and end Medicaid expansion
- cut other important funding to combat the opioid crisis, including gutting the Office of National Drug Control Policy

I appreciate that the President heeded our calls to prioritize funding for State Opioid Response grants in his proposed budget. But, I am deeply concerned that this irresponsible budget proposal falls short in other priorities critical to the safety and well-being of our country.
